alert.note: Alert for Fairfield; Franklin (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 15 at 10:04PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A RAPIDLY DEVELOPING THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF SOUTHEASTERN FRANKLIN AND NORTHWESTERN FAIRFIELD COUNTIES THROUGH 1045 PM EDT... At 1004 PM EDT, a rapidly developing thunderstorm was located over Bexley, moving southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Locations impacted include... Columbus, Reynoldsburg, Pickerington, Bexley, Canal Winchester, Groveport, Whitehall, Obetz, Lithopolis, Carroll, Brice, Blacklick Estates and State Route 158 at State Route 204. This includes the following Interstates... I-70 in Ohio between mile markers 99 and 113. I-71 in Ohio between mile markers 105 and 109. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. Residents in these areas should remain alert. If this storm becomes stronger, then a warning may be needed. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
